newsitem.title: GERMANY: Berzelius profit jumps, paves way for more gains.
newsitem.headline: Berzelius profit jumps, paves way for more gains.

text.p: German waste recycling company B.U.S. Berzelius Umwelt Service AG said on Thursday its net profit jumped 53 percent last year, putting it in line to post higher results this year.
In a mandatory bourse statement the group said its 1996/1997 profit would jump by 20 percent and that sales would climb by 10 percent.

In the 1995/1996 business year which ended September 30, the group posted a 53 percent jump in net-profit to 24.4 million marks ($14.9 million) with sales climbing by 38 percent to 336 million marks. The group's strong 1995/1996 performance will allow it to raise its dividend by 20 pfennings for both common and preference shares increasing them to 40 and 50 pfennigs per share.
Positive business developments in Europe, particularly in Spain, France and Italy as well as China were largely responsible for improved results.
For the current 1996/1997 business year, Berzelius said first quarter numbers were already above plan, putting the company in strong position to meet its targets.
